conversation_summary:
Enduring entities: the ghost-train’s burgundy seats frayed to brown; Harry’s shifting silhouette—child-faced, hollow-cheeked, star-eyed—mirrored in every window; two cracked phones glowing the same broken thread.  
Scene: accordion corridor breathing like lungs between cars; overhead rack holding one anonymous black bag; ticket inspector’s cap rolling uphill against physics.  
Motifs: the typing pulse that never finishes; wind howling through sealed junctions; station lights that arrive and depart at once, promising “next train, next death, next chance.”
